head.supplied: Melbourne botanic & zoologic Garden ¶ 5 November 1860 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you, that the Committee of the zoological Garden has instructed me to bring under your favorable notice, the...

div.p: B63/4078, unit 749, VPRS 1189/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by Carl Wilhelmi and signed by M. Melbourne botanic & zoologic Garden

I have the honor to inform you, that the Committee of the zoological Garden has instructed me to bring under your favorable notice, the annexed shedule of estimates, deemed by the Gentlemen as desirable as a seperate fund for the proposed zoological department.
This sum includes not the special item required for the introduction of Vicunas and pure Alpacas through Mr Charles Ledger, should such meet with your Honors approval.

I beg leave to suggest, that certain reductions of the expenditure of the botanic Garden might be effected in favor of the new establishment without interfering with the efficiency of the botanical Garden.

I have the honor of submitting therefore a new shedule of estimates for the latter, the conjoined sum of both certainly exceeding considerably the amalgamated fund of the botanic and zoologic Garden as proposed in June last for 1861,
M to W. Nicholson, 30 June 1860. this increase of expenditure owing to the necessity of creating a new office and by the proposed wider extension of the zoological establishment.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
&c&c&c
On 27 June 1863 Under Secretary W. Odgers noted that M's letter had been 'recd from Mr Moore on Mr O'S retiremt'. The 'Mr Moore' was presumably the former Under Secretary, J. Moore, and 'Mr O'S', J. O'Shanassy.
